title: Vector algebra relations
summary: The following are important identities in vector algebra. Identities that involve the magnitude of a vector ‖ A ‖ {\displaystyle \|\mathbf {A} \|} , or the dot product (scalar product) of two vectors A·B, apply to vectors in any dimension. Identities that use the cross product (vector product) A×B are defined only in three dimensions.[nb 1][1]
